title: Are there free online courses with free certification? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ivy League Colleges Are Offering Free Only Courses Here is what you need to know about it! Top ranked schools that are known for their global presence have now stretched their reach through a series of multiple free online courses that you can pursue. These schools include the eight Ivy League institutes as well - Brown, Harvard, Cornell, Princeton, Dartmouth, Yale, and Columbia Universities, and the University of Pennsylvania. These courses are known as MOOCs or Massive Open Online Courses and are rapidly becoming popular specially is East Asia and African nations. These courses are also available in India and are yet to accelerate among the youth, hence you have the opportunity to grasp them now to add them to your profile and stand out. We at Jitin Chawla Centre for Career Development keep updating our students on various profile building activities and camps that can really blossom up your profile and rapidly increase your chances for getting admission into the top foreign universities. So far, they’ve created 500+ courses, of which around 450 are still active. We have made a consolidated list of top courses available under all domains. You certainly have a lot of free courses available throughout the Internet these days available on any subject of your choice. In fact, it won’t be wrong to say that YouTube has become a separate academy in itself. But then, free courses aren’t always good. In my personal opinion, when you take up a free online course on the subject you desire to master, you can only get a free certification at the end of it. But when it comes to learning something worth your time there, and even becoming an expert there is a little difficult with free courses. One major problem that I feel with these free or even paid online courses is that they are prerecorded and therefore, you do not get to interact with your trainers and really ask all your doubts that you can come across while learning the subject on your own. There is much nitty-gritty involved while learning a subject of your choice, basically the one that you need to master. Also, it also depends upon what subject you want to choose to make a career in it. There is a very good reason people pursue degrees in subjects they wish to master and make a career in. Having said that, learning a subject like digital marketing, which is a rage these days on the Internet, with tons of free online courses being offered, it is a very practically oriented subject that would not require you to focus only on the theory of the subject. Also, the number of doubts you will have would be higher as compared to other courses and subjects, which are theoretically oriented. If you are seriously interested in learning something and mastering it to be able to make a career in it, you need a professional course on the subject, if not a degree that would help you get an easy entry into the field as well. Therefore, if you want to invest in only online courses, I would highly recommend you opt for the online instructor-led courses on any subject to help you gain the same level of knowledge and interactive sessions along with live projects to work on and 100% placement assistance as well. If you are interested in learning digital marketing, and becoming a master in it, I would highly recommend the best quality course being offered by the Digital Vidya Institute.

Yes there are. Microsoft Virtual Academy : This is the best, they provide certificates at the end of course completion for every courses. But they can’t be sharable of ‘linkedin’ but you can do manually by downloading the certificate and uploading it in ‘linkedin slideshare’ and then providing that link while entering details about certificate. There are learning paths, on completing of that they provide badge which can be sharable on ‘linkedin’. Some of the Learning Paths are : ASP.Net Core 2.0MEAN Stack DevelopmentDevOps for Developers there are so many check out by visiting there site.https://devgym.oracle.com : In this there is one free course that will provide certificate at the end of course. Course Name: Databases for Developers (Taught by Chris Saxon) search for that course after creating an account. Don’t try to login using Firefox Developer Edition it will show error instead use chrome. Online Courses - Learn Anything, On Your Schedule | Udemy : There are some free courses here that provide free certification. Some I’m enrolled for are: Mastering NoSQL Database: MongoDB with PHP andJava Tutorial for Complete Beginners, these two courses are absolutely free and provide certificate at the end.SoloLearn: Learn to Code : They provide certificates after completing the course and they can be sharable on ‘linkedin’ but for some reasons it won’t work but you can do it manually by clicking on share and copy the URL and paste it in a txt file. Now, analyze the URL all the data to complete the certificate information is in the URL. Coursera | Online Courses From Top Universities. Join for Free : Yes, the courses are not free but you can apply for financial aid, provide a valid reason and why you are taking course. There are two courses which are completely free but no certificates are provide at end. Algorithms Part 1 and 2Take these courses if you are interested in learning. That’s it these are what i found and tried, if i found any new free certificate providing courses i will update.

Hi, Online courses, and online certificate courses in particular, are quickly moving from a novelty to the mainstream. Leading colleges, graduate schools and companies are investing significant resources. There are now hundreds of free courses available online, which can vary significantly in quality. That makes it essential to pick the right course. I would suggest that you take a look at ProProfs Training Maker. It is a cloud learning management system (LMS) which is used globally for course authoring purpose. For instance, you want to create a course on the topic ‘workplace harassment’ but not aware the type of content that should be included. Just visit ProProfs Training Maker, create a course using the free templates available in the ‘Take courses’ section and share it with learners within minutes. The process is very simple. To use this LMS tool, you don’t need any HTML skills or download any software. If you already have ready-made content with you, ProProfs LMS will let you use that as well. Just upload a zipped file containing the training materials you may have created using other eLearning tools such as Articulate, Captivate, etc. You can publish the content from your Articulate or Captivate account into ProProfs Training Maker. This prevents you from rewriting the content to create courses. ProProfs Training Maker is TinCan, SCORM 1.2 and SCORM 2004 compliant learning management system. Moreover, you can create, customize and brand a course certificate using the below mentioned steps. create, customize and brand a course certificate? Step 1: Go to My Courses and click "Edit Settings"  Step 2: Under General Settings, check 'Customize what students see at the end of course'.  Step 3: Further, check 'Show Certificate' & click on 'Customize certificate'.  Step 4: Upload your custom cetificate with your own logo & colors.  Step 5: Check "Show custom message' and add a message, which you want to appear on the completion certificate.  Step 6: Click 'Save' & you are Done. After learners complete the course, you can share a course completion certificate as well. ProProfs LMS promises effective eLearning and the truth is that it delivers only what it promises. It is one of the easiest to use cloud-based elearning tool in regard to learning, course delivery, course management and white-labeling. With this next-gen LMS platform, you get complete control over the eLearning course setup, delivery and learner progress tracking along with some excellent functional features that will help you take learning to the next level. Endorsed by reputable global business houses, this tool offers a ‘Free’ plan for the first ten learners and allows creation of unlimited courses (which the learners can access innumerable times), upload unlimited docs (images, videos, PPTs etc), language courses can be created in multiple languages, sell courses and much more. There and varied other enterprise-focused plans (Team, Professional, Business, Enterprise) with 15-day free trial along with the ability to schedule a demonstration. I hope this information helps.

Yes there are BUT one must be careful when you are seeking education to know that you get what you pay for. I mean whatever field you are seeking education you want to have your education accredited. That is sanctioned by an official source. If not your diploma or certificate is worthless and you have wasted your time. It is far better to research a reasonably priced Accredited school/college/university and barrow money and get your education. This way your Diploma is valuable. And it will be a life long asset. You will be able to use your education life long to grow through your career. And make a high enough wage to live and pay your loan off. But before you choose a course of education choose wisely. Make sure there are opportunities Where you want to live, And making the amount of money you need to sustain your lifestyle and pay your educational loan. Blessings on your journey.

Free Online Mini MBA Course The trend called Massive Open Online Courses shortly called as MOOCs are gaining more and more popularity these days. Following this trend, the Great Lakes Institute of Management has recently announced to offer a Flexi MBA Programme. Objective of the programme: This online mini MBA is a non-credit program that can provide a practical foundation to the students about the current business practices. Even though, this mini programme will provide the course takers with the facility to gain the knowledge they need for succeeding within their organization, the objective of the course is to make them competent to take informed business decisions on problems that are affecting business organizations these days. The courses covered under this programme are: Business strategyBusiness communicationMarketing managementManaging HR in the 21st century andAccounting for managers

Coursera no longer provides any sort of free certificates. Actually they never did. However, if you show that you really need the certificates for whatever reason (careers, academics, etc) and demonstrated that you cannot pay for certificates due to financial hardships then they'll provide financial aid for you. Outside of that, there's no way. Probably it is better that way because free certificates are as good as none.

I found that a lot of the courses that were at one point offering free course certificates are now charging. I think MOOCs are generally becoming more aggressive with prices. Stanfords Lagunita offers something called a statement of accomplishment (for free it seems) but I don't know if you can prove it on a resume or what not.

No. As with most things you get what you pay for. A free cert is free so the issuing body had no financial reason to make sure the certificate stays valid and legit. It would cost money to produce the certification, advertise, maintain the verification process, run classes, produce materials, etc, etc.

The best site is Edx,which can provide free courses and also provides certificates worthy enough. The certificates are somewhere around 40–60 dollars which are very cheap. Other platforms like Allison and courseware are a great bet too.

The best free certification course which is available online is LinkedIn learning. You can get 1 month free membership in which you can learn and get the certificate of the course which you are interested in. Also there is direct option to add that certificate to your LinkedIn profile. Apart from that many others apps like sololearn , Udemy also provides free certification.

Yep. I did a quick search on Free Online Courses - Advance your Career and filtered for “free” and “certificate” and found over 3000 courses. Some online training providers offer a downloadable course completion certificate when you have viewed a full course, however to be certified in a specific subject you will still need to sit an exam. Examining institutes do provide online examinations, but you will have to pay for these exams.
